About Me

I do much more than just write code! You can learn more about me in the section below.

Bio/Personal Life

I grew up in Great Neck, NY, and attended college at Brandeis University. After graduating in 2016 with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science and minors in Business and Economics, I started working for Optum as a software engineer. I worked for Optum for three and a half years before switching jobs to my current role at UBMe.

Technical Proficencies

I have worked on many projects in my career covering many different technologies:

Front End Technologies: React, Redux, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular, Material-UI

Application Server/Backend Technologies: JavaScript, Node.js, Express, TypeScript, Java, Spring, Struts, Apache Tomcat, JBoss, Python, Flask, Django

Database Technologies: MongoDB, MySQL, DB2, MSSQL Server

DevOps/Miscellaneous Technologies: Git, Jenkins, Npm, Maven, Docker, AWS, Heroku

Athletic History

I am a very avid runner and I try to run pretty much everyday. I started playing tennis at a very young age, and played up until college. I still enjoy it casually, but do not play competitively anymore. Most other sports I played for a few years or casually such as basketball, skiing, baseball, and swimming.

Hobbies and Interests

Outside of programming professionally and for fun, playing sports, and hanging out with friends, I love to travel and take pictures; these two pictures are from Iceland and Israel, respectively. I also love playing video games. I still play Nintendo's latest releases of Mario and Pokemon games, as well as strategy games like Hearthstone and Sid Meier's Civilization V.
